definition: to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: I am the person named above as a candidate at the above - mentioned by-election .
sentences.chinese: 本人乃參与是次补选之上述候选人。

sentences.english: The by-election procedure shall be analogically governed by Article 15 of this Law.
sentences.chinese: 补选程序参照本法第十五条的规定办理。

sentences.english: Eng Huat was elected Member of Parliament in the 2012 Hougang By-Election.
sentences.chinese: 荣发在2012年后港区补选中当选国会议员。

sentences.english: In the Permatang Pauh by-election, 70% of the voters were Malays .
sentences.chinese: 然而在峇东埔补选中，70%的选民是马来人。

sentences.english: An incumbent Member of any District Council cannot be nominated at the by-election .
sentences.chinese: 现任区议员得在今次补选中接受提名。

sentences.english: I have decided not to take part in the by-election of the chief executive in July.
sentences.chinese: 我决定不参与七月的特首补选。

sentences.english: Suu Kyi will likely test the reforms by standing for a vacant parliamentary seat early next year.
sentences.chinese: 素季或于明年初参加议会补选，以测改革。

definition: seat in a parliament or legislative assembly
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
